abstract: Memo From Lebanon; Beirut residents, who endured double suicide bombing day before coordinated terrorist attacks in Paris, express mixed feelings about international outpouring of sympathy for France; solidarity with victims is tempered by sense that Arab society and lives are misunderstood, neglected and viewed as less important
lead_paragraph: A global outpouring of grief followed the Paris assaults, but no such solidarity was expressed a day earlier when 43 civilians were killed in Lebanon.

headline.main: Beirut, Also the Site of Deadly Attacks, Feels Forgotten
headline.print_headline: Beirut, Also the Site of Deadly Attacks, Feels Forgotten

snippet: A global outpouring of grief followed the Paris assaults, but no such solidarity was expressed a day earlier when 43 civilians were killed in Lebanon.
